column2: Text
We predict an imminent astromagnetic storm. Exercise extreme caution when operating equipment during this time.
A meteorite shower is approaching Sinus Ardorum! Extreme caution is advised when working outdoors.
Observations of nearby spongoi suggest an imminent occurrence of sporing mist. We advise that all workers stay alert for irregular specimens.
We've detected an approaching thunderstorm, but we know when it will pass over us! We advise anyone working outdoors to exercise caution.
Atmospheric pressure is down, heralding annealing winds! Take whatever measures necessary to protect yourselves from their cold bite!
A massive cloud of condensed aether approaches, and we expect glass rain to follow! Visibility will be extremely limited, so stay safe out there!
Red Alert: Astromagnetic Storm
Red Alert: Meteor Shower
Red Alert: Sporing Mist
Red Alert: Thunderstorm
Red Alert: Annealing Winds
Red Alert: Glass Rain

Severe gravitational fluctuations detected in Terra Firma. All personnel are instructed to brace for unpredictable weightlessness.
Floating seawater event detected on the Magnetic Horizon. Exploration zone personnel are warned to expect bubble bloom conditions.
Approach of Progenitrix-level extreme low pressure front confirmed. Gale-force winds expected. Field personnel are advised to take shelter.
